isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SYSTEM DESCRIPTION - SYSTEM CONTROLS

svcprocinfo.para: The lift axle controls are available in two configurations. Either all of the controls are located inside the cab, or the controls are split between inside the cab and outside the cab. The same four controls are used in each of the configurations ( FIGURE 5) . The lift axle controls consist of the following:

item.para: an AXLE ENABLE switch (one switch per truck) - to activate the remaining electrical controls of all the lift axles on the truck,
a Lift Axle UP/DOWN switch (a separate switch for each lift axle) - to raise and lower the indicated lift axle,
a Pressure Regulator control (a separate control for each axle) - to adjust the pressure in the load air springs on the indicated lift axle,
a Pressure Gauge (one gauge per axle for in-cab controls; two gauges per axle for mixed controls) - to indicate the pressure in the load air springs on the indicated lift axle.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Lift Axle Control Panel (Panel Shown is for Two Lift Axles with In Cab Controls)

svcsubproc.title: IN CAB CONTROLS ONLY
svcsubproc.para: In this configuration all of the axle controls are located on a floor mounted pedestal next to the driver's seat. The controls accessible from the driver's seat are the AXLE ENABLE switch, the Lift Axle UP/DOWN switch, the Pressure Regulator and the Pressure Gauge ( FIGURE 6). For a more detailed description of in-cab controls, refer to the IN-CAB CONTROLS section .

figure.caption: Figure 6. Lift Axle Controls (Control Panels Shown are for Three Lift Axles)

svcsubproc.title: MIXED CONTROLS - PRESSURE GAUGE AND SWITCHES IN CAB/PRESSURE GAUGE AND REGULATOR OUTSIDE
svcsubproc.para: In this configuration the AXLE ENABLE switch, the Lift Axle UP/DOWN switch and a Pressure Gauge are located on a floor mounted pedestal next to the driver's seat. The Pressure Regulator and a second Pressure Gauge are located on an external panel located at the rear of the cab ( FIGURE 6). This arrangement allows the load air spring pressure to be set from outside of the cab, while still allowing the control switches and Pressure Gauge to be accessible from the driver's seat. For a more detailed description of the mixed controls, refer to the MIXED CONTROLS section .
